result.execSummary:
The defendant Jennifer Ann Salgado was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Possession of THC [Modifiers: PTAC, as a Party to a Crime], an unclassified misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(3g)(e).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Payment of $100 fine + costs + service fees + DNA surcharge = $863.50 less $500 bond on deposit = $363.50 due at a rate of $50 per mth comm 11-15-2022 or civil judgment and referral to State Debt Collections.

records.addlTxt:
2:33 PM Defendant Jennifer Ann Salgado in court.  Attorney Jon G Spansail in court for Jennifer Ann Salgado.  Prosecuting attorney DeShea D. Morrow in court for the State of Wisconsin. 
Atty Spansail - provides plea form.
DA heard on agreement.
Atty Spansail agrees.
DA reads charge in Count 1.
Court arraigns Deft.
Deft enters guilty.
Non-citizen advisory.
Elements of offense.
PleaQuest/WOR.
Constitutional rights.
Read-ins.
Deft understands.
Atty Spansail - satisfied.
Factual basis.
Court finds Deft enters plea freely, voluntarily and intelligently; therefore court accepts plea and finds Deft guilty.
Court dismisses and reads-in Counts 2 & 3.
DA heard on sentencing.
Atty Spansail heard on sentencing.
Court heard on factors.
Court imposes on Count 1:
10 days jail w/good time and Huber release if in compliance with jails rules and regulations.  Credit for 10 days - time served.
Payment of $100 fine + costs + service fees + DNA surcharge = $863.50 less $500 bond on deposit = $363.50 due at a rate of $50 per mth comm 11-15-22 or civil judgment and referral to State Debt Collections. 
DNA sample due 10-13-2022 by 4:00 pm.
Appeal rights.
2:50 pm

10:15 AM Defendant Jennifer Ann Salgado appeared by video, in custody.  Attorney Jon G Spansail appeared by video for Jennifer Ann Salgado.  Prosecuting attorney DeShea D. Morrow in court for the State of Wisconsin. 
Court heard on FTA of Deft.
DA heard on bail and priors.
Atty Spansail heard on bail.
Court sets $500 cash bail w/conditions: sign waiver of extradition, no contact w/co-defts, no possession or consumption of alcohol or controlled substances w/o valid prescription.
Court schedules w/parties.
10:23 am
Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for October 12, 2022 at 02:30 pm.

Court calls case
No appearance by def
Atty Spansail is being heard on defendant's nonappearance
DA requests Warrant
Court authorizes Bench Warrant
8:30 AM

9:06 AM Prosecuting attorney DeShea D. Morrow in court for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant Jennifer Ann Salgado in court.  Attorney Jon G Spansail in court for Jennifer Ann Salgado. 
Court calls case. 
Copy of complaint. 
Max penalties and charges. 
Enters NG on all counts. 
Requests STC.
Court schedules with parties.

Status conference scheduled for September 9, 2022 at 08:30 am.
